favourite.article: Our costly and valuable spiritual treasure is a gift from the Lord after paying a great price "without money" and willing to give it back to Him if He asks for it. Remember Abraham and Isaac?
I wonder what is the meaning of spiritual treasure in this song. What does spiritual treasure here refer to?

This song reminded me of my favorite footnote, from Matthew 8:26 - "The disciples considered Mary's love offering to the Lord a waste. Throughout the past twenty centuries thousands of precious lives, heart treasures, high positions, and golden futures have been "wasted" upon the Lord Jesus. To those who love Him in such a way He is altogether lovely and worthy of their offering. What they have poured upon Him is not a waste but a fragrant testimony of His sweetness." Lord, this is my consecration to You. I love You Lord. I willingly waste myself upon You.

favourite.article: I'm eating some sweets while enjoying this hymn, but the song is much sweeter than the food. We are not wasting our life while serving the Lord, it's most valuable heavenly thing. I'm Shu, 26 now, accomodating in Matsudo, Japan. I'm originally from Shanghai, China... but I am not good at speaking a kind of Standard Chinese.
The goal of the gospel is that, Loving the Lord Jesus With the first love...

I still remember that training in Anaheim, brother asked us all (the young people) to stand up and sing this banner song, and asked the elders to pray for us while we were singing. It truly touched my heart, and made me consecrate myself to my dear Lord.

Цель благовестия состоит в том, чтоб, любя Господа Иисуса первой любовью, Мы изливали на Него Самое драгоценное для нас, Даже самое дорогое и ценное Духовное сокровище, Ценное духовное сокровище, «растрачивая» Себя на Него, на Него. Моложёжные гимны № 150 (Лозунг Летнего обучения 2009 года)
Oh Lord Jesus I do love You...
Went on a trip with my friends and fell in love with this song. I have it on my YouTube page and listen to it all the time.

Wooo.... Even our most precious and valuable treasures wasting upon Him... We sang this hymn a lot of times in the Poland camp, and it was such a sweet one for me, then it was the first time I heard it. Now I sing it, and repeat it, such a sweet fellowship, so intimate.
Lord, I want to "waste" myself upon You. What others might consider a "waste", to me it is a wonderful way to live - to give all to my Creator, to the Holy One...to the Lord.
This is also the title of the last message in "The Normal Christian Life" by W. Nee. In my opinion that message is the best in the whole book.
福音的目標，乃是要我們用起初的愛──愛主耶穌； 把我們所最寶貝的，甚至把我們最貴重、最有價值的屬靈珍寶， 澆在祂身上；把我們自己──『枉費』在祂身上。
